title: Brit mum, 62, dies in mysterious circumstances while pursuing yoga teacher dream
text:

A British mum has died in mysterious circumstances in Mexico while pursuing her dream to be a yoga teacher.

Phyllis Main is reported to have fallen ill while staying at the luxurious Princess Mundo Imperial hotel in Acapulco.

The 62-year-old had been on a £13,000 nine-week Bikram 'hot' yoga course.

Bikram yoga, which involves 90-minutes of stretching in extreme heat, has become popular with celebrities such as Andy Murray and Madonna.

The mother-of-two, who attended the Damn Hot yoga club in the Finnieston area of Glasgow, travelled across the Atlantic on October 3 to join hundreds of others to take part in the course.

(Image: dailyrecord.co.uk/)

The Mail on Sunday reports the bank worker fell ill with stomach pains and was taken to hospital but it's not known whether her illness had any links to the yoga.

A day before she jetted off she took to Facebook to reveal her excitement about heading to Mexico to become a teacher.

She wrote: "Well that is my last class in Damn Hot.

"Acapulco tomorrow to become a Bikram Yoga teacher love this yoga if it’s not 90 mins it’s not Bikram Yoga.

"Will miss you all."

On arrival in Acapulco she kept her pals back home up-to-date about her holiday in the sun, posting pictures and videos on the beach.

(Image: dailyrecord.co.uk/)

Bikram yoga became hugely popular worldwide, however it was hit by scandal when students accused founder Bikram Choudhury of rape and harassment.

He continues to run the course which teaches hot yoga performed in warm and humid studios a

A Foreign and Commonwealth spokesman said: “Our staff are providing consular support to the family of a British woman who died in Mexico”.
description: Phyllis Main had been on a £13,000 nine-week Bikram 'hot' yoga course at the luxurious Princess Mundo Imperial hotel in Acapulco
